meta_description: Goodwood Museum & Gardens is a wonderful place to visit! Come for a tour of our 180 year old Main House. We're a great place to host your next event!
hours_text:
Goodwood Museum and Gardens welcomes World Cross Country Championship participants!

Enjoy our free, scenic 20-acre grounds‚Äîperfect for a walk or jog.

# Plan Your Visit

### Gardens & Grounds Hours

Monday-Friday | 9am-5pm  
Saturday | 10am-2pm  
Sunday | Closed

**_Grounds are free and open to the public during museum hours of operation._**

### House Tour Times

Tuesday-Friday  
10am, 11:30am, 1pm, 2:30pm

Saturday  
10:00am, 11:30am, 1pm

### Admission

Adults: **$15**

Veterans, Students & Seniors: **$12**

Active Duty Military, National Guard & Reserve: Free

Students: **$12**

Children 6-12: **$8**

Groups of 10 or more: **$10** per person

ID required

Groups of 10 or more may require advance registration to accommodate. All other admissions do not need to be made in advance.

#### Accessibility

The Carriage House, cafe, and Roller Rink are accessible for wheelchairs and have designated accessible parking.  
An elevator is available for Individuals with health concerns or impairments who wish to tour the Main House museum.

# Virtual Ground Tour

# Directions & Parking

1600 Miccosukee Rd  
Tallahassee, FL 32308  
Phone: (850) 877-4202

The Museum‚Äôs main entrance is located off Miccosukee Road, just East of Tallahassee Memorial Healthcare. The Museum‚Äôs back entrance can be accessed off Surgeons Drive.

_Click images above for more information._

## Memorial to the Enslaved

Goodwood Museum & Gardens, a former plantation, will create a memorial to all people enslaved on the property from approximately 1832 until 1865. A permanent outdoor memorial site has been chosen on a half-acre space adorned with several large live oaks and a bank of azaleas. The memorial will list the names of known enslaved persons, and will be a site for sober contemplation and remembrance. It will also be a site for meeting, teaching, community engagement, and healing.

For more information or to get involved, visit our memorial page.

[Visit Memorial Page](/memorial/)

[WFSU Radio Interview](https://news.wfsu.org/wfsu-local-news/2021-10-06/goodwood-museum-and-gardens-to-memorialize-those-who-were-enslaved-there?src=dailynews)
